intro: Tristagma lineatum, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that have a hairy surface. Its small, pale green flowers are clustered in spikes and bloom in the summer months. Tristagma lineatum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
